lines.line: What's all this about?
Ah, hello and welcome. I'm Martin Holt, leader of Kourend's Royal Society. This is our little protest against the Kourend Council.
Pleased to meet you, I'm. So, what's wrong with the Council?
Now there's a question! I have a better one. What's right with the Council?
I bet you didn't know that the Council was originally only temporary. After the last King died, they were only supposed to rule until his daughter came of age.
However, according to the Council, the King's daughter went mad. Such a wonderful convenience for them of course. With her out of the picture, the Council became permanent.
Interesting. What else don't you like about the Council?
Democracy! That's meant to be the big thing for the Council. Funny thing is, although they're meant to be elected by the people, the same four people have won every single election. Little odd, no?
That is a bit suspicious, I suppose.
Indeed it is. So, do you want to join our protest?
Not right now. But thanks for the information.
Oh my friend, suspicious is the dish of the day whenever the Council is around. And what I've just told you barely scratches the surface. Things have been getting even worse recently.
How so?
Do you know of Councillor Sophia Hughes? Lovely lady. Spends her free time with the Disciples of Yama, a wonderful cult of Zamorakian demon summoners.
Councillor Hughes? I was the one who helped imprison her in the first place.
Ah, so you're the adventurer who's been cooking up a storm around here. Well you'll be pleased to know your hard work was all for nothing. Councillor Hughes has escaped. Lucky her.
Escaped? How?
Believe it or not, no one actually knows. The Council is trying to keep it all on the down low of course. Almost like they have something to hide.
That's quite the accusation. Do you have proof?
Oh, we will soon! Just you give it time. They'll slip up sooner or later.
Hmm... Rather than just waiting for that to happen, maybe I could investigate her escape.
What an interesting idea. I suppose you would be well placed to have a little nosey, considering your history with the Councillor. Though you'd need to get permission, of course.
How would I do that?
I hear the Kourend Royal Guard are leading the investigation. Commander Lydia Fullore is their leader. You'll find her in the castle.
I'll go speak to her.
Good luck friend. Your eyes are open now. Don't trust the Council.
Well, I think I'll stay out of this one. Good luck with your protest.
As you wish, but you shouldn't be afraid to open your eyes. If you change your mind, we'll be here.
Hey there. Remind me, where can I find Commander Fullore?
She'll be somewhere in the castle.
Thank you.
Hello. Who are you?
I'm Commander Lydia Fullore, leader of the Kourend Royal Guard.
Then you're just the person I'm looking for. I'm. I hear you're the one to talk to about the recent escape of Councillor Hughes.
Ah, let me guess, you've been talking to Martin Holt?
You know him?
Oh, I know him alright. Martin and I have quite the history.
Really? He didn't mention it.
He wouldn't. He has a very selective memory. I imagine he also didn't mention that he used to work for the Council that he hates so much.
No... that's not something that ever came up.
Well I imagine his Royal Society friends wouldn't make so much of him if they knew where his loyalties used to lie.
So I'm guessing you don't agree with his views on the Council.
Well I wouldn't be very good at my job if I did. Martin is always quick to point out the failings of the Council, but he conveniently forgets about all the good they've done.
Like?
You know that smell in Port Piscarilius?
It is a bit ripe there.
Imagine that but ten times worse. That's what it was like before the Council had a new sewage system installed. The entire kingdom is now cleaner and safer because of them.
Not only that, but without the Council, you wouldn't even be stood here. It was under them that trade with your lands to the east was established.
Without those trade routes, you would have no easy way of getting here.
I could go on, but I have more urgent things to attend to.
Like the escape of Councillor Hughes?
Well, since it's clearly no secret, yes. The former Councillor is a dangerous individual, so I want her back in a cell as soon as possible.
You know, I might be able to help you with that. In case you didn't know, I was the one who helped catch her in the first place.
So, this is what Martin has put you up to! Well, no thank you. The last thing I need is one of his people getting in the way.
I'm not one of his people! I barely know him. I'm just a willing adventurer who wants to help.

Think about it. However this investigation goes, you'll be seen as biased towards the Council. I'm a neutral third party with no ties to the Councillor or the protesters. I'm in an ideal position to help out here.
Hmm... you do have the experience. And I can't deny, the fact that you have the support of the protesters could be useful.
This whole situation with Councillor Hughes has caused enough civil unrest. We certainly don't need it to get any worse.
Alright, you can help. But for the duration of this investigation, you're working for me. What I say goes, is that clear?
Crystal clear. Where do we start?
Right now we don't have any leads on where Councillor Hughes might have gone. I'm heading over to her home to see if there's anything there that can help us. You should join me.
Let's get going.
Commander Fullore! How wonderful to see you.
Tomas! What are you doing here?
Why, I'm here about Sophia Hughes of course! As the person who discovered her corruption in the first place, I was an obvious choice to lead the investigation into her disappearance.
But that wasn't you! I did all the work!
Ah, and hello again, my financially challenged friend! Of course, the capture of Sophia Hughes wouldn't have been possible without your minor contributions.
The Kourend Royal Guard are conducting the investigation, Tomas. Your presence is not needed.
Well, that's just the thing. Councillor Andrews was so impressed with my work, he put me in charge of this investigation.
That is not his call to make! I'm in charge of Council security. This investigation is mine to lead!
He is head of the Council. If he wants to make that call, he can.
Regardless...
Look, I can see you're very passionate, which is wonderful. Tell you what, as you're so eager, I'll allow you both to help me in my investigation.
Do join me inside when you're ready.
Captain Ginea. I'm guessing Lord Shayzien sent you.
He did. He's keen to see this Hughes business sorted quickly.
He's not alone there, but he doesn't need to worry. We have things under control.
Forgive me Commander, but it doesn't seem like you do. Hughes escaped from right under your nose, and now Councillor Andrews is putting his faith in Lawry over you.
While this may be Council business, Lord Shayzien is responsible for dealing with both internal and external threats. He wants to be sure that Hughes won't be an issue.
You have my word. She'll be back in a cell before the day is out.
I hope you're right. There's already a lot of doubt in the Council these days. It would be rather embarrassing for them if the Shayzien Army had to step in.
For someone who supports the Council so much, you don't seem very happy about Councillor Andrews' decision.
I can support the Council while not agreeing with every choice they make.
I feel like you're not totally being honest with me.
Would that be so wrong? I hardly know you.
Here's some advice for you: focus on the investigation. Leave the politics to the experts.
Fine. I guess we'd better get started.
Have a look around the house and see if you can find any hints on where Councillor Hughes might have gone. I'll ask around out here and see if anyone's seen anything suspicious.
Sounds good.
Good luck. Don't let Lawry get in your way.
I just need to do something first.
Okay, just let me know when you're ready to depart.
Are you ready to head over to Councillor Hughes' home?
Hello again. I hope things are going well.
Not too bad thanks.
Well, keep up the good work. After all, it would be very awkward for our friends on the Council if you caught Sophia Hughes again.
Hello again. Your desire to help out with my investigation is to be commended, but you really shouldn't worry. I'll have the former Councillor back in a cell in no time.
So you already have some leads?
Not just yet. It won't be long though. Not with my resourcefulness!
Yeah... second only to your humility.
How very kind of you. I should tell you though, a skillset like mine isn't gained over night. If you wish to become like me, it will take a lot of hard work.
I'll keep that in mind. Anyway, I should get back to work.
I've found something that might be useful.
Oh yes? What is it?
Looks like the Councillor might be hiding out at Mount Quidamortem.
Mount Quidamortem? That's quite the trek.
I could go if you like?
How very kind of you, but no need. This is my investigation, and I will handle it.
Sucker.
If you say so.
I think I know where Councillor Hughes has gone.
Where?
The Farming Guild.
Huh, not where I'd have expected. But maybe that's the point.
If you think that's where she is, I'd recommend you go and check it out. I'll keep an eye on things here.
Okay. Where abouts is it?
North of the River Molch, west of here.
Thanks.
The Deeper Lode.
Seems a risky place for her to go. I'd have thought she'd pick somewhere quieter.
If you're sure though, I'd recommend you go and scout it out. I'll keep an eye on things here.
It's the pub in Lovakengj, north west of here.
The Little Shop of Horace.
You don't think Horace is helping her, do you?
Well we can't make any assumptions.
True. If that's where you think she is, I suggest you go and check it out. I'll keep an eye on things here.
It's the general store in Hosidius, south east of here.
The Chasm of Fire.
That's where most of her cultist friends spend their time, seems a bit obvious.
I guess it could still be worth a look. If you think she's there, you should go and scout it out. I'll keep an eye on things here.
On the outskirts of Shayzien, west of here.
Actually, I don't know.
Well, keep looking around. There must be something here that can help us.
What was the date when Councillor Hughes escaped?
It was two days ago, on the 26th of Fentuary.
Hang on... If she escaped two days ago, why are we only searching her house now?
The start of the investigation was... delayed. I can't say any more.
Hmm...
Did you know there's a demon upstairs?
A demon? Well I guess the Disciples of Yama are known for that sort of thing. Still, that's going to be a nightmare to deal with. Can it get out?
I don't think so.
Good. Do your best to avoid it and we'll worry about it later.
What should I be doing?
Have a look around the house and see if you can find any hints on where Councillor Hughes might have gone. I'll ask around out here and see if anyone's noticed anything suspicious.
Sounds good. I'll let you know if I find anything.
Hello. I'm looking for Sophia Hughes.
Sophia Hughes? The councillor?
That's right. I think she might have come here at some point.
Well, if she did it wasn't recently. We'd have noticed a councillor.
I see. Thanks for the help.
Hello, I'm Horace. Welcome to my shop. Would you like to buy or sell something?
Had any councillors shop here recently?
Not as far as I can recall. Councillor Hughes used to order things from time to time, before she was arrested. None of the others have ever shopped here though.
Hmm, fair enough.
Welcome. Have you come to give your soul to the Chasm?
I'm looking for Sophia Hughes.
You are not alone in that, but you will not find her here.
She's one of your lot though, right? This seems like a good place for her to hide.
You are welcome to go in and check. You will find nothing. Sophia Hughes no longer has a place here.
Hmm, if you say so.
Hello, human. What's your pleasure today?
Had any councillors stay here recently?
Councillors? What do you mean?
I'm investigating the disappearance of Councillor Sophia Hughes. I have reason to believe she rented a bed here.

A disappearing councillor? That's a new one. We don't really get many humans renting beds here. The only one recently was a woman who stayed here last night, but she didn't look much like a councillor.
She could have been in disguise. Do you know where this woman is now?
Well she left not long before you got here. I didn't really speak to her but I did hear her mention something about catching a ship at Port Piscarilius.
A ship? She's trying to escape! Do you know which ship?
Well let's see now...
Blimy! That was a good one!
What on Gielinor was that?
Ah, not from around here are you? That was an earthquake. We get them here from time to time. I think they come from that volcano to the west, but I'm no expert.
Anyway, what were we on about?
The Councillor.
Ah yes, the Councillor. I seem to recall her mentioning Veos. It must be his ship she's taking.
I need to get there quick. Thank you for the help.
Not a problem. Good luck with your search.
So about the Councillor.
You again? I've already told you everything. The woman mentioned Veos over at Port Piscarilius. She must be catching his ship.
Ah yes. I need to get there quickly.
Fuggy: Good luck.
Err, where's Veos?
Your guess is as good as mine. He was here until that earthquake. Then he suddenly just wandered off, like he was in some sort of trance.
But what about his ship?
I guess I'll have to look after it until he comes back. I hope he won't be long. I'm not really cut out for this kind of thing.
I'm looking for a councillor.
What do you mean?
I believe Councillor Sophia Hughes is planning to board this ship. I need to find her.
The one that got arrested? If she wants to board the ship she'll need to do it soon. We're nearly ready to cast off. I guess you could wait around and see if she shows up.
Not a bad idea. I think I'll do just that.
Heard you were out here. Thought I'd come see how things are going.
Not spying on me are you?
Spying is a strong word. I just like to keep an eye on people I've not worked with before. Especially in a situation as delicate as this one.
That's one way of putting it.
So, what of Hughes?
She booked passage on this ship, but she's not arrived yet. If she's coming, it will be soon.
And we'll be here when she does. Not bad.
Starting to trust me now?
Don't get ahead of yourself.
Ah, looks like we might have a visitor.
Sophia Hughes. Going somewhere?
You! This is all your doing!
The only person to blame is yourself. When you play with fire, you get burnt.
It's over, Sophia. You should come quietly.
Commander Fullore! He would send you, wouldn't he? The little lapdog of Councillor Andrews!
He knew, you know! They all did. They were more than happy with my work while it was secret. But now they betray me without a second thought, just to protect themselves!
You'd think they'd have some loyalty after all we did! After what we did to him. After what we did to his girl! We were in it together until it no longer suited them!
What are you on about? What girl?
Don't think I'm coming quietly! I've fought too hard to stop now!
Judge of Yama, hear my voice! I call upon you to bring justice to the unworthy! Cleanse them in a sea of fire! Cleanse them in a sea of blood!
Sophia Hughes. You have called upon me. Those that oppose you will be judged in the name of Yama.
But know this, Sophia Hughes. Those that call upon the Judge must first be judged themselves.
You have betrayed the trust of Yama, Sophia Hughes. You have used his generosity to your own advantage. For this, your life is forfeit.
What? No!
Come. Serve your master one last time. Bathe yourself in a sea of fire. Bathe yourself in a sea of blood.
No... Wait!
And so the justice of Yama has been brought upon Sophia Hughes, as it will be brought upon all who wrong him.
Lydia Fullore,. You have been declared enemies of Yama. Your actions have endangered the work of his children. For this, your lives are forfeit.
Hey! You can't just show up and start incinerating people. That's not how justice works. How about you clear off, before I make you!
. You have challenged the Judge of Yama. Your guilt will be determined through combat.
Should you succeed, you will be free of your sins. Should you fail, you will be bathed in fire. You will be bathed in blood.
Now, in the name of Yama, let us begin.
Here he is, the hero of the hour. On behalf of the Council, and indeed all of Kourend, thank you for dealing with this messy situation.
It was nothing.
You're far too humble. You've done so much for our kingdom in your short time here. Rest assured, we have noticed. In fact, I consider you a firm friend of the Council.
Have you managed to work out how Councillor Hughes escaped?
Not yet. You need not worry though, we'll get to the bottom of it. That said, I do have another ask of you... if you don't mind.
What is it?
Commander Fullore tells me you've had dealings with Martin Holt and his group.
I'm not sure about dealings, but we've met.
Well regardless, your handling of the situation with Sophia Hughes seems to have had quite an impact on them.
Well, I am quite impactful. So, what is this ask?
This recent situation has been most unfortunate. People are angry, I understand that. That said, Sophia Hughes has been dealt with. It's time for Martin Holt and his protestors to go home.
Ah, I see. You want me to convince them.
It would be greatly appreciated. Civil unrest is of no benefit to anyone. We'd all be better off putting this behind us.
Now, I must be off. Plenty of work to do. Good luck with Martin and his friends.
So what now?
We're looking into how Sophia Hughes might have escaped. I'll let you know if we find anything.
You know that's not what I mean.
I'm not sure what you're on about. Now, I'm sorry, but I need to get to work.
*whispers* Meet me just south of the castle.
So?
Councillor Hughes was a deranged cultist.
And yet?
I don't know...
Do you not know? Or do you just not want to admit it? The man and the girl she spoke of. What did she mean?
Ever since King Kharedst IV died, there have been those who have questioned his death. People like Martin.
It was all just wild speculation, though. The King was old, and he died of an illness. It happens all the time.
The man Councillor Hughes mentioned. It could have been the King she was referring to.
Maybe. Or maybe it was someone else.
And the girl she mentioned? The King had a daughter.
Rose. She was meant to take the throne after him, but she was too young. His advisors took over until she came of age.
The Council. It never went that way though, did it? She never took the throne. Martin said they declared her mad.
Grief can do a lot to someone. Rose and her father were very close.
Listen to us! Are we really considering this? The Council rule Kourend. They have done so successfully for 20 years now.
What happened to Rose in the end? Where did she go?
After what happened, public life was no place for her. The Council arranged for her to move away so she could escape all of that.
So where is she now?
Look, I'm the commander of the Kourend Royal Guard. My duty is to the Council.
As commander of the 'Royal Guard' your duty is surely to royalty, not to some Council.
What kind of person would I be if I betrayed them?
What kind of person would you be if you followed them blindly, even when all the evidence says not to?
I'm sorry, but I can't.
Oh come on...
I can't! But you can.
Councillor Andrews may have been all nice to you, but he's furious with me. He's blamed me for what happened in Port Piscarilius. I have no hope of doing anything now without him knowing.
But you, on the other hand... You're just some adventurer as far as they're concerned. They won't be keeping an eye on you.
But where would I start?
Rose. If she's still alive, then she's the key to the truth. You have to find her.
How?
I'm going to hate myself for this, but I know someone who could help.
Martin. He's leader of Kourend's Royal Society. He knows more about the last royal family than anyone. If anyone can help you find Rose, it's him.
Now, I need to get back inside, before someone finds out I'm missing.
Thank you, Lydia. I know this can't be easy for you.
I really need to go. Speak to Martin, and good luck.
Hello.
No time to talk I'm afraid. Didn't Councillor Andrews want you to speak to Martin Holt about his protest?
Hello again, friend. Isn't it a wonderful day? Sophia Hughes has been dealt with and our wonderfully corrupt Council are out rowing without a paddle. Keep up the good work!
Good to see you, friend. Excellent work with Sophia Hughes!
Hello Martin. I see your protest is growing.
Indeed it is, friend. Would you believe it that apparently some councillor went and summoned a demon in Port Piscarilius? That made a lot of people angry.
It seems the guards have also taken interest.
No doubt sent by the Council to keep an eye on us. We've got them scared now.
Maybe they think things will get violent?
And yet they're the ones with the weapons. Interesting, huh?
Anyway, what can I do for you, friend?
There's something important we need to talk about.
Something important? Is it about the Council?
It is.
Well, what is it? If you have news on the Council, we must let the people know at once.
This one needs to stay between you and me.
The people have a right to know, my friend.
They do. But if what I've discovered is true, we can't let the Council realise we know until we have definitive proof.
I see. This sounds serious. What have you learnt?
When I confronted Sophia Hughes, she spoke of things the Council did to a man and his daughter.
A man and his daughter? Surely this can't mean...
Kharedst IV. The last King of Great Kourend.
I knew it! I knew the Council were involved in his death!
Like I said, we have no proof. The dying words of a cultist are not going to be enough to convince many. We need real proof.
And this is why you came to me? You have a plan?
The King's daughter, Rose. If we can find her, we might be able to find out what happened.
But my friend, no one knows where Rose is! Some don't even think she's alive any more. Sadly, most people have just forgotten her completely.
But you haven't! You must have some idea of where they might have taken her.
I'm afraid not. However, I wonder if Rose herself might be able to help.
Err... What?
The Council didn't declare Rose mad right away. It wasn't until a few weeks after her father died that she was moved away.
But how does that help us?
Rose was well known for being a good writer, even at her young age. She documented everything she did. She even wrote her father's memoirs for him.
If something happened in those few weeks, maybe she wrote about it.
Ah, I understand now. That does make sense.
You know, I actually ended up acquiring her father's memoirs myself.
You did? Interesting. The memoirs were auctioned off recently, along with a lot of other royal possessions.
The auction was a request from the King before he died. He wanted the money to go towards helping the poor of Kourend.
You know, I actually ended up acquiring her father's memoirs myself. There was an interesting page hidden in the book. It suggested that something bad happened to whoever wrote it.
And you're only mentioning this now? You had proof that something happened to Rose, and you did nothing with it?
Well it wasn't really proof of anything. It gave no details on what actually happened, and no leads to follow. It wasn't even clear if Rose wrote it.
Even still, something like that might have been worth bringing up.
Well, now you know. I don't see how it helps us, though.

The memoirs were auctioned off recently, along with a lot of other royal possessions. The auction was a request from the King before he died. He wanted the money to go towards helping the poor of Kourend.
The King's been dead for years. How come the auction only happened recently?
For that you can thank our Council friends. They blocked it for years. They said Rose's things should not be included, as the original request only covered her father's possessions.
I did wonder if they had more malicious motivations, and now you've confirmed it. They clearly didn't want anyone getting their hands on Rose's writings.
Were there any other writings, apart from the memoirs?
Yes. Rose's personal diary. It went to the Library Historical Archive. I hear they have it on display there.
So I need to go to the Archive and get that diary.
The Archive isn't the Library. You can't just borrow things. I doubt they'll let you take it.
To be honest, I wasn't actually planning on asking.
A who knows what needs to be done. I respect that. Talk to Archeio in the Arceuus Library. He can take you to the Archive. Come back once you have the diary and we'll discuss our next steps.
What do I need to be doing?
Rose's personal diary is on display in the Library Historical Archive. We need to aquire it. Talk to Archeio in the Arceuus Library. He can take you to the Archive.
Welcome to the Library Historical Archive.
I have a question about Rose.
Rose? The princess?
That's right.
Ah, poor girl. Her tale is such a tragic one. What would you like to know?
I heard her diary was on display here. I was wondering if I could read it.
You are correct that we have her diary. It's in the display case on the eastern wall. That said, I'm afraid I can't let you read it.
The diary is here to be preserved. However, we do not feel it appropriate to let people read the private thoughts of a young girl.
I see. Fair enough.
Is there anything else I can help you with?
Good to see you, friend. Any luck with that diary?
Good work. Now, let's see if this diary has anything for us...
Hmm. Doesn't look to be anything obvious, but that's not suprising. Anything too in your face would have been found by the Council long ago.
The hidden page from the King's memoirs was hidden inside the book cover.
Let's see if the same trick has been used here.
Let's try this...
And what do we have here?
Very interesting. See what you make of this.
Well?
It's a riddle.
That it is. It seems to be describing a location. If we find that location, maybe we'll find something of use.
We should split up. The Council could be watching us, and I don't want to make anything too obvious. Let's see who can solve this thing first.
Alright. Good luck.
We should split up and try to solve the riddle. I'll regroup with you at wherever it leads us.
Well here we are.
You think this is definitely it?
Forthos was the seat of the Hosidius family before it was destroyed in the War of the Five Houses. 'A seat of power, lost in a war of pride.'
Anyway, looks like I won this one. What's my prize?
I don't think there is one.
Pah, that's where you're wrong my friend. This could lead us to the ultimate prize. This could lead us to the truth behind the delightful Kourend Council.
You really do hate them don't you? You know, Lydia told me you worked for them once.
Is that a problem?
Just interesting. You went from working for them to being their biggest opponent. What changed?
I opened my eyes. When I worked for the Council, I was young and naive. But over time, I came to see the truth.
The tipping point came a couple of years ago. I was helping to manage the treasury at the time. We had a big donation come in from a private businessman. Lovely chap.
He was ever so noble. Something eating away at his conscience, no doubt. He wanted the money to go towards improved education in Port Piscarilius. He felt it would help with the crime levels there.
That was of course a big no-go for the Council. Helping the people? No chance! Instead, they used only a small amount for that. They spent the rest on castle renovations.
They claimed the increase in castle tourism would make more money in the long run. A load of tosh! I knew it was just for them.
I walked out that same day. Soon after, I founded Kourend's Royal Society. We've been a bane for the Council ever since.
Why not mention this before?
Wasn't really important. I'm sure Lydia didn't tell you everything about herself either. We were together once, you know. But she was ever loyal to the Council.
In the end she decided I wasn't her type, and went off with that Captain Ginea instead. Of course, that didn't work out either. One day she'll stop blaming her problems on everyone else.
Is this relevant?
Nope. And neither is my history with the Council. Now, let's crack on. Rose led us here for a reason. There must be something hidden nearby.
What do you know about Rose?
She was born to King Kharedst IV as his first and only child. Her mother died when she was very young, so her father mostly looked after her on his own. The two were very close.
She was only 11 when her father died. Even at that age, she had already proven that she was smart, capable and caring. She'd have made a good queen, but the Council put a stop to that.
She was 11 when the King died? How old would that make her now?
31? So wherever she is, she's spent most of her life there. If she's still alive of course.
You'd hope that even the Council wouldn't go as far as to kill her, but that's probably wishful thinking. They're as evil as they come.
What happens when we find Rose?
Hopefully she can give us the truth about her father's death.
Okay, but say the Council are guilty? What happens then?
Oh they're guilty my friend, make no mistake. We just need proof. Once we have it, we can use it to have them removed from power.
After that, Rose can take her rightful place on the throne.
And if she's incapable of doing that?
Let's cross that bridge if we get to it.
Tell me about Kourend's Royal Society.
The throne of Kourend has sat empty for far too long. After all, what is a kingdom without a king? That was the question I asked myself when I created the society.
You see, I'd grown tired of our wonderful Council and their dishonourable ways. I wanted a return to how things used to be. Turns out I wasn't alone.
Kourend's Royal Society offers a place for likeminded individuals to share and debate their views without fear of being judged.
It's not just about debate though is it? You're trying to spread your views to others with your protests.
We know the Council to be corrupt. We feel it only right that all of Kourend know that. The people have a right to the truth.
It's interesting that you focus on power for the people but desire a monarchy. Surely a democracy would be more fitting?
Democracy is just a façade, my friend. The Council! They're meant to be a democracy! It's all a load of rubbish. Democracy is just a way of pretending the people have power.
Maybe, but I don't see how you fix that with a king or queen.
Kings and queens are raised from birth to rule. They know how to do it right. Under a king or queen, this kingdom would flourish.
I can't say I'm convinced.
Even with a monarchy, the people still hold the power. Sometimes it just takes them time to realise it.
King Lathas of Kandarin was raised from birth to rule. I'm not sure he did a great job.
And what happened to him in the end?
The people had him executed.
Exactly! Even with a monarchy, the people still hold the power. Sometimes it just takes them time to realise it.
I'll get searching.
Found anything yet?
Not yet.
Keep looking.
You could help, you know.
I'll have you know I am helping. I'm looking here.
You've been looking there for a while now.
I'm being thorough.
I'll be back later.
Yes! I've found another note.
Well what does it say?
'Out in a land that's frozen to the bone. A village of statues, not made of stone.'
Another riddle. Well, same again then. Let's split up and see if we can find where it leads.
Alright. I'll see you soon.
We should split up and try to solve the next riddle. I'll regroup with you at wherever it leads us.
Ah, you made it. Welcome to Kourend's top holiday destination. Here you'll find all sorts of fun things like cold, cold and cold.
You can say that again. I'm guessing this panel is what we're after.
Looks like it. Problem is, it's locked and...
Hang on, do you hear that?
Martin Holt. You have been marked for death.
Crikey! Are you alright?
I'm fine.
So now the Council are sending assassins after us. They've got some nerve.
We don't know it was the Council.
Who else would it be?
The assassin only named you. Surely the Council would want me gone as well if they knew what we were doing.
Yes, a good point. They clearly don't know what we're doing yet. This must be about the protests instead. They wanted to silence me!
Again, we don't know that.
It's the only logical explanation. The Council are running scared. They can feel their grip on Kourend loosening and are desperately trying to stop that.
Well, Council or otherwise, the assassin is dealt with. Now we need to get this panel open and get out of here.
Very true. I tried to open the panel before you arrived, but it needs a key. Perhaps it's hidden nearby.
I'll have a look around.
Any luck?
The panel had another note behind it.
Excellent. What does this one say?
'Hearty drinks are a sailor's friend. Where one long journey comes to an end.'
Another one. I wonder how many there are.
Only one way to find out, I suppose.
Indeed. Let's split up again. Be careful though. Who knows if the Council will send another assassin.
We should split up and try to solve the next riddle. I'll regroup with you at wherever it leads us. Be careful though. Who knows if the Council will send another assassin.
Now this is more like it! A nice temperature and a good source of beer. Not to mention the fact that the Council wouldn't dare send an assassin somewhere so built up. Even they're not that stupid.
Rose certainly went all out. I wonder how she managed it?
Apparently Rose and her father would often make riddles for each other. I'm guessing she was quite fond of them.
Even so, I wonder how she set it all up?
Never underestimate a child, my friend. I remember a gang of thieves a few years back that used them heavily. The kids could get places the adults couldn't. No one ever suspected them either.
They were such a problem that the Council had to get Lord Shayzien to send some soldiers in to deal with them. Lydia was one of them. This was before she joined the Royal Guard.
What happened?
The Council had them all thrown in prison, even the children. Lydia was distraught. Still, it didn't stop her joining the Royal Guard. She was always blind to the truth.
So were you, once. You said that yourself.
True, but at least I realised in the end.
You know, it was Lydia who sent me to talk to you about all of this in the first place.
So?
So maybe she's not as bad as you say.
Maybe. Anyway, we have a clue to find. Time to get searching.
Uh oh.
Martin Holt.
Tomas Lawry! Backbone of the Kourend Council!
How very kind of you.
Of course, it's a shame the Council are totally spineless.
Hmm. What are you doing here Martin?
I'm here for a drink of course. This is a pub, you know. Lovely place to sit back and relax. You should try it some time.
This would be easier if you told the truth.
I am telling the truth. Is it illegal to go to the pub now?
For you, I'm afraid it is. Martin Holt, I am arresting you for inciting violence against the Kourend Council.
Inciting violence? You must be joking! All I've done is express my valid concerns. There is no law against that!
You have encouraged people to take up arms against the rightful rulers of Kourend.
I have given the people a voice! You cannot silence us all!
The people can express their concerns through the proper channels. Now, I must ask that you come with us at once.
And if I refuse?
Come now, Martin. Let's not go there. You know how it ends.
Fine! But the people will not stand for this. I will not be responsible for what happens now!
Looks like I'm on my own now.
Oh my.
Err... Hello.
Can you hear me?
Rose?
What the... Who are you?
I could ask you the same question.
This place is private! You're not welcome here!
Well here's the thing: I don't actually care.
I came here looking for someone, and I think this woman here might be that someone. If she is, you're in a whole different world of trouble.
So tell me, who are you?
My god...
You're looking for Rose, aren't you?
Is this her?
It... Yes, this is her.
And you are?
I'm Councillor Liam Orson, of the Kourend Council. But please, you have to understand...
Yes, I'd very much like to understand. Why are you here with Kourend's missing princess? And why is she just lying there like that?
I suggest you explain everything. You should probably do it fast, as well.
I don't know where to begin.
How about with her father. How did he die?
There was something wrong with him.
You expect me to believe that?
It's the truth!
He was always a fan of antiques. One day he bought some old flask from a stall in Lovakengj. He began drinking from the flask wherever he went, and it started to change him.
Change him?
The flask was cursed. Some dark magic. He stopped being himself. Started saying things. Things he would do to people. To the citizens!
We did what we had to...
You killed him. You killed him and took his throne for yourselves.
No... We never wanted the throne. The throne was always meant for Rose.
Well that clearly didn't happen.
She was never meant to be involved. We were just going to look after things until she was ready. But she found out what we did.
So you did this to her?
We didn't want to hurt her, but we couldn't risk her telling anyone. This was the only way.
Well, you failed. She got the word out. It took 20 years, but thanks to her, your rule is at an end.
So, what happens now?
That's not for me to decide. There's someone who needs to see this.
Is it... Is it really her?
I think so.
And you say she's not aware of... anything?
Doesn't look like it.
What a mess.
What of the Councillor? Where is he?
I locked him in the other room. Didn't want him running off. I'll get him.
You can come out now.
Councillor.
Commander.
Liam... tell me it isn't true.
I'm sorry Lydia.
I defended you! I defended all of you! And all this time, you've been lying!
I swear to you, we did it for the people.
Don't give me that!
Look at her! Look at what you did to her! She was a child, Liam!
I'm sorry.
What did you do to her? Why is she like this?
We didn't want to kill her. She didn't deserve that. The mage gave us a potion. He said it would stop her revealing the truth.
Mage? What mage?
There was an Arceuus mage. He was an expert in curses, and he realised what was happening. He gave us the poison for the King.
Would have been nice for you to mention this earlier! Who was this mage?
He never told us his name.
And you trusted him? Are you serious? Some random mage comes along and tells you to poison the King and you just... do it?
Everything the mage said was true. The King was cursed. We could see it.
Did it ever cross your mind that maybe this mage was the one that cursed him in the first place? How do you know he wasn't just using you?
Of course it crossed our minds, but we didn't have a choice. The King was deteriorating by the hour.
You could have gone to Lord Arceuus! You could have gone to Lord Shayzien! You could have gone to anyone apart from some random mage!
This mage. Have you met him since?
Yes. Rose's condition...
You mean the condition you gave her?
Her condition has no cure, but it can be kept in check with regular treatment. He meets with me and gives me the potions she needs.
How do you know it's not the potions that are doing this to her?
I've done my research. The potions are safe, and she can't live without them.
Where is this mage?
We meet outside Molch. I think he lives in the temple there, with the lizardmen.
This mage. We need to find out who he is.
I'll go to Molch. If he's there, I'll find him.
Good luck out there. I'll keep an eye on this... I don't even have a word for him.
Try not to kill him.
I'll do my best.
How are you doing?
I'd rather not talk about it. We have work to focus on. There'll be plenty of time to contemplate later.
How are things back at the castle?
Terrible. I take it you heard about Martin?
The arrest? I was there.
Such a stupid move. I told Councillor Andrews not to do it, but he listened to Lawry instead. Now the protestors are even angrier.
At this rate, it's only a matter of time before things get violent. I even had Councillor Unkar moved to the castle for his own safety.
Not that he deserves safety! What a mess this is.
I'd better be off.
Councillor.
Oh, hello there.
I have a question for you.
What do you know of this mage?
Very little. It was David... Sorry, Councillor Andrews, who he contacted first. The rest of us didn't meet him until much later.
He was an expert in old curses. He could see what was wrong with the King. He told Councillor Andrews and offered his help.
By then, it was already too late. The King had deteriorated too much. There was only one solution.
I don't know if that's true.
You weren't there. You didn't see what was happening to him. There was no time to consider other options. We did what we had to do.
If you say so. You said he lives in Molch?
That's right. In the temple, I think.
A mysterious mage with no name who lives with some lizardmen. He sure sounds like an upstanding citizen with nothing suspicious about him at all.
You're not funny. Do you think we'd have worked with him if we knew all of that? We didn't find out about the lizardman connection until much later. By then, the deed had already been done.
I'm suprised you'd even care about lizardman. They're pretty tame compared to demon summoning.
Sophia wasn't always like that. Before she joined that cult, she was just like the rest of us. The only difference was that she had other beliefs.
Zamorakian beliefs aren't particularly welcome in most places.
So what? People should be entitled to their beliefs!
Sure, but I suspect being entitled to summon demons is more up for debate.
Like I said, she wasn't always like that.
What happened with Rose?
I know you probably don't believe it, but we always meant for her to take the throne.
I guess I'd probably have an easier time believing that if she wasn't lying right here instead.
She overheard us talking about the King. We couldn't let her tell anyone.
But why? If it was really all about her, why would it matter what happened to you?
Because without us, who would have been left to rule? We had to do it for the good of Kourend.
Did you? Or have you lied to yourself so much that you now actually believe it?
She was like a daughter to me!
So you poisoned her?
And I have taken care of her every day since! Without me, she wouldn't even be alive.
Is what she has now really much of a life at all?
You don't understand...
To be honest, I don't know if I want to.
Actually, never mind.
You need to find out who this mage is.
Don't worry. I'll work it out.
Yesss?
I have a question about that door over there.
Yesss? What about it?
Not got any mages hiding behind it have you?
Magesss? You know of the Yo'kal ahk?
Yo'kal ahk?
It isss the name we ussse for the mage you ssspeak of. In your ssspeach, he hasss another name.
This mage. Where did he come from?
He hasss been here sssince our massster ssstill walked among usss. He wasss sssealed away before, but they releasssed him so he could guide usss.
I need to see this mage. How do I get through the door?
It is closssed, but there are keysss. We shhhamansss carry them.
Well can I have your key?
Perhapsss. But why shhhould I help you?
I could just kill you instead?
And I could shhhout for help. Humansss are not meant to be in thisss temple. Do you think you can sssurvive usss all?
Alright. What do you want in return?
A trade? Yesss, that worksss well.
The mage you ssspeak of. He sssends us to fight the humansss. He sssays we mussst do it for our massster, but he isss long gone.
I am done with thisss fighting. I want to ssserve our massster in other waysss.
I could help you escape?
I am a shhhaman. I need no help from humansss.
What, then?
The hatching area in the ssswamp, to the sssouth wessst of here. My lassst egg isss there. If I go and it ssstays, it will die in thisss falssse war.
So if I bring you this egg, you'll give me the key?
Yesss. The egg isss marked with the sssymbol of our massster. Go fassst human.
So, about the key to that door...
Yesss. I can give you the key, but firssst I need my lassst egg. It'sss at the hatching area in the ssswamp, to the sssouth wessst of here.
Alright. I'll bring you the egg.
It isss marked with the sssymbol of our massster. Go fassst human.
Yesss. I can give you the key, but firssst I need my lassst egg.
I have it here.
Thank you, human. You have given usss a chance for a new ssstart. Here isss the key.
Be cautiousss of the Yo'kal ahk human. He isss very dangerousss.
I'll be careful.
Ye niauh, human. Perhapsss we will meet again.
So, about that door over there...
Ussse the key I gave you. That will get you inssside. But be cautiousss of the Yo'kal ahk human. He isss very dangerousss.
...actually quite surprised. I thought you of all people would have made more of an effort to find me.
Your greatest achievement was my downfall, my lord. The lizardmen blamed me for your disappearance and sealed me away. I was trapped for centuries.
And yet, here you are.
I managed to convince their shamans I was on their side. They set me free. I have been trying to find you ever since.
Except you were beaten by a treasure hunter.
With humble respect, my lord, this treasure hunter is not the one to thank.
It was me. I was the one who worked out how to find you. I planted the seeds that eventually led him to you.
A proxy? Interesting. I wouldn't have thought you would be one to hide away.
The world has changed. Working from the shadows has served me well. And now it has reunited us once more.
Yes, the earthquake. That was a considerable amount of dark energy. Something I could not ignore. But to what end?
The same end as always, my lord. Quidamortem has been lost to us, but there are other ways to harness the Dark Altar.
I see. And tell me, what of this Council that now rules Kourend? I sense your work at play there.
I needed access to the Altar. They were a means to an end.
You installed some puppet rulers just to access the Altar? My my, Xamphur, you haven't lost your ambition.
Never, my lord. I also hoped that access to Kourend would have further uses, but I fear the Council is done.
From what I hear, you are likely right. No matter, though. Kourend is of limited use to us.
My lord?
That kingdom was always a means to an end. A disappointing necessity while we were still shackled.
But now, those shackles are gone. I have discovered a new way to achieve our goals, and this time, none will stand in our way.
Now, we have much time to make up. Unfortunate, but bearable. Soon time will be of little meaning to us.
Ah, but on that note, it seems this conversation is at an end, for we are no longer alone.
Deal with your guest Xamphur. We will meet again in the south.
It will be done, my lord.
Veos?
What the...
Oh... Hi there.
So I think I took a wrong turn somewhere. I'll just go now...
Go? No I don't think so.
You have heard too much. You have seen too much. You won't be going anywhere.
Ah. Well in that case... Xamphur, was it? How about you tell me what on Gielinor is going on here?
Really? You think this is the part where I tell you everything?
No, no, no. This is the part where you die.
Really now? You actually thought you could defeat me?
What are we sssupposssed to be doing?
The Yo'kal ahk wantsss thisss corpssse removing.
Are you sssure it'sss dead?
It looksss dead.
Eugh...
It'sss a zombie! Let'sss get out of here!
Huh? What happened?
I guess I should have a look around.
Hmm. I should tell Lydia about this.
You're back.
I am. Where's the Councillor?
Don't worry, I didn't kill him. I was sick of looking at him, so I moved him somewhere safe. He won't be going anywhere.
Did you find the mage?
I did, but he got away. To be honest, he also left me with more questions than answers.
What happened?
His name is Xamphur. I overheard a conversation between him and someone else. They talked about the Council, among other things.
The weird thing is, the person he was talking to... I think it was Veos.
The treasure hunter?
Yes. He disappeared after that earthquake, but I saw him with this mage.
The conversation? What was it about?
Xamphur called Veos, or whoever it was, his master. It sounded like he had been seeking him out for a long time.
They talked about the Council and the Dark Altar. I couldn't make much sense of it, but I managed to look around after they left.
From what I found, it seems that Xamphur worked with Councillor Andrews to manipulate the other councillors into killing the King.
Councillor Andrews was in on it from the start? That monster.
It seems he always wanted the throne. Xamphur offered it to him in return for access to the Dark Altar.
The Dark Altar? Why?
Xamphur has been redirecting power from the Altar, but I don't know why. It seems his work is what caused the recent issues in Arceuus.
The death? I heard about that.
Makes you wonder what else he's been responsible for.
I'm not sure what any of this means, but it can't be good. We need to do something. But first...
What?
Rose. What do we do with her?
I did some research while you were gone. Liam wasn't lying. The poison they gave her irreversibly destroyed her mind. There is no cure.
I suspect Xamphur won't be making her any more potions any time soon. Maybe someone in Arceuus could help?
Someone else could make the potions, but all they do is prolong her suffering.
What are you saying?
This is no life for anyone. The truth is, Rose died long ago. All that's left now is an empty shell.
Oh... I think I understand.
I'm sorry, Rose.
Back when I was a girl, there was this Shayzien patrol that would go past our house each morning. Every day I would run out to wave at them as they went by.
For as long as I can remember, I always wanted to join the army. 'Become a farmer or a chef,' my parents would say to me. 'The army isn't for you.'
But I knew what I wanted, and I knew nothing would stop me from getting it.
I saw some nasty things while serving the Council. I'd always tell myself that it was necessary.
Whenever I thought about giving up, I'd ask myself who I'd be replaced with. Even if things weren't perfect, I was in the best place to improve them.
It was all a lie though, wasn't it? It's always been a lie.
I've spent most of my life serving a bunch of murderers; turning away from the truth because I was so scared of being wrong.
To think it was Martin who was right all along!
We can still make this right. We can still stop the Council.
We won't be able to do it alone. The Council still holds the power in Kourend.
I'm not sure if that's true. The real power is held by the five houses of Kourend. Together, they could replace the Council and take over the kingdom.
We'd need to get them all on board.
Leave that with me.
Alright, you gather the five leaders. Convince them to meet us at Xeric's Lookout, south east of Shayzien.
It's where I left Councillor Orson. We won't be disturbed there.
Consider it done.
It feels wrong, her being out here. She should have had a proper funeral.
It's not so bad. It's nice and peaceful. She's finally free from the drama of Kourend.
I guess you're right.
We'd better get going. Good luck.
You too.
Have you spoken with all the leaders yet?
I'm still working on it.
Keep at it. We'll need all five of them on board. When you speak to them, tell them to meet us here.
Councillor Orson is down there. I'm keeping it locked, just in case.
Fair enough.
Good day friend.
Hello Lord Arceuus. There's something I need your help with.
What do you need?
We should discuss it in private. It involves the Kourend Council. It's also connected to the recent death here.
I see. Then I will come at once. Where shall we meet?
Xeric's Lookout.
Very well. I will join you there soon.
Thank you Lord Arceuus.
About the Council...
I will join you at Xeric's Lookout soon.
Hello there.
Lord Hosidius. I need to discuss something with you.
What is it?
We can't talk about it here. I need you to meet me at Xeric's Lookout.
Well you have helped me in the past. That said, I can't just go running off to Xeric's Lookout for no reason.
It's about the Kourend Council.
Ah, I see. Then the day has finally come.
What do you mean?
There has been discontent with the Council since the day they took control of the kingdom. That was always going to come to a head at some point.
It seems that point has now arrived. I will depart for Xeric's Lookout shortly.
Will you be departing for Xeric's Lookout soon?
I will. But there are a few things I need to prepare first.
Oh look, it's the human. Hello human.
Lady Lovakengj. I need you to join me at Xeric's Lookout. There's something urgent we need to discuss.
Urgent?
That's right. We can't discuss it here, but it involves the Kourend Council.
Oh. Well you really should speak to Councillor Unkar. He's part of the Council, you know.
That's not quite what I meant. It's not something to discuss with the Council themselves. It's something I need the house leaders for.
Oh...
So will you come?
Come where?
To Xeric's Lookout. To discuss this Council business.
Ah yes, the Council business at Xeric's Lookout. I will come at once, but first...
Jorra! Bring me a sherry.
Yes Lady Lovakengj.
So about that Council business...
Yes, yes. Come to Xeric's Lookout. I'll be there as soon as I've finished this sherry.
What do you want?
I need your help. It's about the Council.
Anything to do with that demon you summoned on my docks?
That wasn't me! Besides, I'd have thought you'd be happy to see Sophia Hughes dealt with.
I'd have preferred it be done without demons being involved. Idiots will be idiots, I suppose.
Come on then, tell me about this latest Council nonsense.
We can't discuss it here. We need to be somewhere more private.
Oh I'm sorry. Is my secret hideout in the sewers not private enough for you now?
Well... not really. Meet me at Xeric's Lookout. We can talk more there.
Fine. But if you waste my time you will seriously regret it.
Okay. Whatever you say.
Do you want to get off my back? I already said I'll meet you there. Now clear off.
There's something urgent I need your help with.
What is it, citizen?
It involves the Kourend Council, but we can't really discuss it here. Come alone to Xeric's Lookout.
Alone?
I appreciate it's an unusual request, but yes please. All of Kourend could be at stake here.
Well I suppose you have been a friend to Shayzien in the past, and this does sound serious.
Very well citizen. I will depart soon.
I will depart for Xeric's Lookout soon, citizen. I have a few things I need to do first.
Well you did it. It's been a while since I've seen the leaders of all five houses together. They're downstairs waiting.
Is the Councillor there as well?
He is. I told him about Rose.
How did he take it?
How do you think?
We'd better keep a close eye on him.
Indeed. Now, let's get down there.
This is quite the group you've gathered here.
Indeed it is my lord, but I assure you, it's for a very good reason.
Liam.
My lords and ladies, there is something I must make you aware of.
It's regarding myself and my fellow councillors. We...
Yes?
I can't...
Yes you can Liam, and you will.
Don't you lecture me! You have no right! You killed her!
What on Gielinor are you fools on about? Killed who?
They call me a murderer, but they killed Rose! I kept her safe!
No. You killed Rose. You killed her 20 years ago. It's time to stop hiding and accept the truth.
Rose? You speak of the King's daughter. What happened?
This coward here killed her, just like he killed her father.
We did it for the good of the kingdom...
You did it for yourselves!
The King was cursed!
The King was cursed so that you had an excuse to kill him. It was never about the people, it was only about the throne.
That's not true!
I have seen proof with my own eyes. If you think overwise, then you have been fooled as well.
Could you idiots please stop arguing and give us an explanation!
Councillor Andrews plotted to kill the King with a mage called Xamphur. Xamphur cursed the King so that Councillor Andrews had an argument to get the others on board.
And then they killed him?
Yes. Rose as well.
Rose was never meant to get hurt! She overheard us!
Rose was smart, but do you really think she just happened to overhear you? I've no doubt Councillor Andrews arranged for that to happen as well.
So it's true! I always knew the Council was corrupt, and now we have the proof!
So what do we do with this proof?
That's why we gathered you all here. The Council needs to be removed from power. You five can make that happen.
If the Council are to be removed, they will also have to be replaced.
Who should replace them?
Could there be another member of the royal family still out there?
I doubt it. The Council's plan worked because Rose was the King's only heir.
You'd see us go back to a king? The democracy of the Council was false, but democracy is still the answer. Let the people decide!
Since when did Lady Piscarilius care for the people? Last I checked, your citizens lived in constant squalor.
Don't you lecture me you warmongering fool! I've done more for this kingdom than you'll ever know!
Well if you really do care for the people, surely a monarch is perfect. They're crying out for one right now.
The royalists do have a lot of support at the moment. But who would this monarch be?
I believe I may have an answer to that.
What is that?
The Royal Accord of Twill.
Indeed. This here is the answer to our issue.
Once, in a time of great need, the five houses of Kourend took control of this kingdom. Now it falls to us to do so again. It's time for a new accord.
You would see us rule together?
In a way. Together we would all be responsible for Kourend, but a single individual would rule over the kingdom.
A new Royal Accord would require all five us to agree on the contents.
Well don't go thinking you're getting me to sign it. I'll have no part in this.
Lady Lovakengj, you've been silent on all of this. What are your thoughts?
Well... I don't really understand. The Council rule Kourend. We can't just take over.
We have to. There is no other option.
Goodness... I think I need a sherry.
A break might be beneficial to all of us. We have a lot to consider.
Good idea. Let's reconvene later.
Well that was fun. What do we do now?
This Royal Accord seems like our best bet. A clear document signed by all of them that determines the future of Kourend.
For them to all sign it, they all need to agree on the contents. That's not going to be easy.
No, but there must be a way. They all seem to have some level of trust in you. Maybe you can convince them.
I can give it a go.
This could quickly get interesting, but you need to do whatever it takes to get them back at that table. If even one of them walks away, we'll end up with a big problem on our hands.
Alright. I'll go and talk to them all.
Good luck.
What do you think of Lord Arceuus?
He intrigues me. I find there's a certain level of arrogance when it comes to anyone from Arceuus. Living for a thousand years will do that, I guess.
The thing is, he's not like that. He seems to have a lot more humility than the other leaders.
Still, I find it hard to trust anyone who's been around that long. Think about what he must have seen and done over the years. He'll have more secrets than the rest of them combined.
What do you think of Lady Piscarilius?
She's lazy and arrogant. She talks like she cares for the people, but one look at Port Piscarilius shows the truth. She only cares for herself.
Maybe there's more to her than meets the eye.
You think she really cares?
I wouldn't rule it out.
Maybe she should start looking after her citizens then. Thoughts and feelings mean nothing when people are suffering.
What do you think of Lord Hosidius?
He's well-liked by his people, and he does genuinely seem to care for them. The world might be a better place if more leaders were like him.
That said, we should still be careful. Everyone has two sides, and he knew exactly what he was doing when he brought out the Royal Accord of Twill.
What do you think of Lord Shayzien?
I have a lot of respect for him. He's achieved a lot in his short time as a ruler.
But?
Does there need to be a but?
No, but there generally is one.
He's a man of war, not peace. You always need to be careful with someone like that. He's also the youngest of all the rulers. Age often brings experience.
Often, but not always.
True.
What do you think of Lady Lovakengj?
I think she's the most dangerous of all of them.
She seems to be nothing more than a slightly senile dwarf with a love for sherry. If that's true, then she's not the kind of person who should be in charge of anything.
But maybe that's not who she really is. Maybe it's all just an act. If that's the case, then she's managed to fool everyone around her.
Either way, she's one to keep an eye on.
The biggest threat is the one you never see coming.
Exactly.
I'd better get going.
Any luck with the leaders?
Keep at it. We need to find a solution that they all agree on.
Leave me alone! I have nothing to say to you.
Hello Lord Arceuus.
Hello there. I was hoping you'd come and speak with me. There is much we need to discuss.
About the Council?
Not exactly. That revelation is concerning and needs to be addressed. However, I fear we may be facing a much larger issue.
When we spoke before, you mentioned that all of this had some connection to the death in Arceuus. Tell me, does that have anything to do with the mage you mentioned?
That's right. Xamphur was his name. I discovered his hideout in the Lizardman Temple below Molch.
He was the one responsible for the device that was redirecting power from the Dark Altar, but I'm not totally sure what he was using the power for. That recent earthquake was also involved somehow.
I see. And did this Xamphur look similar to an Arceuus citizen?
He did. How did you know that?
Xamphur is not a common name, and yet it is one I have heard before. During the Age of Strife, Xeric himself was assisted by a loyal servant of that same name.
You don't think it's the same person do you?
Once, we would never have considered it. However, a recent discovery you made yourself means it's a very real possibility.
The altar at Quidamortem.
Yes. Thanks to that altar, Xeric and his followers had access to the same power that keeps every citizen of Arceuus alive.
With that power, they may well have lived much longer than originally believed. It's possible one of them even lives to this day.
There's something else as well. When I found Xamphur, he wasn't alone. I think the other person was Veos. The weird thing is, Xamphur spoke as if Veos was his master.
This isn't exactly the first odd occurrence when it comes to Veos either. A while back I helped him with some strange client of his.
When we were done, this client spoke through Veos himself. The things he said were... strange.
Hmm. This is interesting and concerning. Perhaps this client is the one Xamphur considers his master.
But if Veos' client is Xamphur's master, and if Xamphur once served Xeric, could that mean...
Be careful, friend. Empty speculation will be of little help to us here.
But surely it's an option we should consider?
Of course. However, if you consider one option too closely, you'll become blind to all other possibilities. What we need here is proof.
And how do we get that?
My friend, I must ask that you once again to pay a visit to the Tasakaal at Mount Karuulm. With their power, they will be able to determine if this Xamphur is the same one that served Xeric.
The power of the Dark Altar leaves traces. If Xamphur's soul inhabits a body created using the Dark Altar, the Tasakaal will be able to determine when that body was formed.
Would they not need his body for that?
Ideally, but I suspect this will also work.
Since you destroyed it, we've been researching this device to try and determine the origin. Thanks to you, we now know that it was made by Xamphur.
Alright, I'll take the device to the Tasakaal and see what they can do with it. However, I also need to ask for your support with this new Royal Accord.
The Council must be removed and a replacement is needed. I will gladly support the new Royal Accord. But first, we must focus on Xamphur.
Okay. I'll be back once I've discovered something from the Tasakaal.
Hello there. Have you spoken with the Tasakaal?
Please do so soon. Only they have the power to determine who Xamphur is.
Hello there. I'm guessing you want to discuss the Royal Accord?
That's right. I assume you won't have any issues supporting it, considering it was your idea?
It's a messy business, but the Council has to go. That means a replacement is needed. A new Royal Accord is our best hope for a peaceful transition of power.
Now, that said, there are some preparations I need to make before we finalise things. Perhaps you could help me with that.
Well if it gets things done faster, then I guess so.
As with the Royal Accord of Twill, our new accord will see power transferred to the five houses. However, only one of them will rule.
The Royal Accord of Twill saw each of the houses take it in turns to do this, but we may want to take a different approach this time.
I'm almost certain that Lord Arceuus and Lady Piscarilius will not wish to rule. Lady Lovakengj likely won't either. That leaves myself and Lord Shayzien.
And would you be willing to take on that role?
Well, that's where my preparations come in. While I can't say I'm too keen on ruling Kourend, I'm not sure if Lord Shayzien is the right man for the job either.
How come?
Take a look through the pages of Kourend's history and you'll soon see that soldiers do not make for good rulers.
As such, before any final decision is made, there's something I'd like to look into when it comes to Lord Shayzien.
As you probably won't be too surprised to hear, I have people who keep a close eye on things around Kourend. They let me know of any interesting occurrences that could impact Hosidius.
Not too long ago, I was informed that Lord Shayzien went for a private walk in the Kourend Woodland. While there, he stopped off at a small Barbarian Camp.
That's an interesting place for him to visit.
It is. I'm sure it's nothing to worry about, but I'd like to be sure before we make any big decisions.
Okay. I can go and take a look around this camp.
That would be appreciated. It's directly south of here in the Kourend Woodland.
Alright. I'll let you know if I find anything.
Hello there. Any luck with that barbarian camp?
Very well. Let me know if you discover anything. The camp is directly south of here in the Kourend Woodland.
Hello Lady Lovakengj.
Oh, it's the human. Hello human.
I wanted to talk to you about this Royal Accord. Would you be willing to support it?
Royal Accord? Hmm...
No I don't think so.
Why not?
Why not what?
Why can't you support the new Royal Accord?
Ah yes, the new Royal Accord. Well Councillor Unkar has been a good dwarf his whole life. He can't be involved in any of this.
I know it's hard to hear, but I think he is.
No, no, no. That's not right at all. You must be getting confused somewhere. Councillor Andrews is the problem.
Oh, I know! We can replace Councillor Andrews with Councillor Unkar. What an excellent idea! This calls for a sherry.
Lady Lovakengj please, you have to believe me! Councillor Unkar isn't innocent in this.
Well you can't go believing Councillor Orson! He's clearly just jealous of Councillor Unkar's success.
Okay, well how about I find some proof that Councillor Unkar is involved? Then will you support the Royal Accord?
Oh... well I suppose so, but I don't think you'll find any. Councillor Unkar is innocent.
Right. Let me chat to Commander Fullore about this.
I'm still looking into things with Councillor Unkar. I'll let you know once I find something.
Okay human. I'm sure you'll soon see that Councillor Unkar is innocent.
Hello there.
We need to talk about this Royal Accord.
Don't waste your time. I will never sign that thing.
So you'd see the corrupt Council stay in charge?
Of course not, you fool. Did you not listen earlier? The people should decide, not us.
Well it seems like there's a clear solution to this then.
I doubt that.
For the Royal Accord to be finalised, we can have the people vote on it. That way, they get the final say.
It would still see us return to a single ruler.
Only if that's what people want. If they vote no, we come up with an alternative arrangement and let them vote on that instead.
Eugh.
Come on now. If you do care for the people, this is the best option.
Fine. It's still a stupid move, but if there's to be a vote, I might be willing to support it.
Might?
Yes. First, there's something else we need to discuss.
Of course there is.
While you've been running around chasing dead princesses and mad mages, you've forgotten what started all of this. You summoned a demon in my home!
No... I killed a demon that someone else summoned in your home. You should thank me.
Really? Thank you for being as useless as I feared.
How about we skip over the insults this time and you just tell me what you want.
The Disciples of Yama are a big problem. They need dealing with.
Tell Lord Shayzien to send the army in, then. They literally live right on his doorstep.
Exactly! They live on his doorstep and he cares more about stupid lizardmen. The man is clearly as incompetent as you.
Thanks. So it sounds like you want me to take on this cult singlehandedly? I feel like that won't go well.
Of course I don't expect you to take on an entire cult! What you need to do is cut the head off the snake. Remove the influence of their leader and they won't be a problem.
So, what? Kill Yama?
No. Yama has no presence among his followers. At least, not yet. If you remove their connection to him, he won't be able to communicate with them.
I know of a mage in Arceuus who's hopefully not as useless as you or Lord Shayzien. Her name is Mori and she's been investigating the Disciples of Yama. She should be able to help.
Woah! Slow down there. How do you know all of this?
Because I did some digging. Oddly enough I wasn't going to ignore a corrupt councillor summoning a demon on my docks.
You learnt all of this just with a bit of digging? There's something you're not telling me here. Besides, why would you care so much about this compared to everything else going on?
This conversation is pointless. If you want my support, this is the price. Now go and talk to Mori. I hear she spends most of her time in the Arceuus Church.
Fine. I'll be back later.
Have you spoken to Mori yet?
From what I hear, she spends most of her time in the Arceuus Church. Now clear off.
Ah, there you are citizen. There's something I need to discuss with you.
The Royal Accord?
Correct, citizen. Once the Council are removed from power, we will need a new ruler. I for one think this Royal Accord is the perfect move.
I think we can also agree that when the times comes, I will be a suitable candidate to rule. These are unstable times. My military leadership will put me in a good position to take over.
Do you think the other leaders will support that?
I've no doubt they'll consider me a strong contender. That said, I expect Lord Hosidius will also be considered. On that note, there's a job I have that would be perfect for one with your skills.
Before we come to finalise this Royal Accord, we need to be sure that everyone is in a place where they can pick the right ruler.
While Lord Hosidius seems like a good man for the job, I've recently obtained some intelligence that could suggest otherwise. I'd like you to look into this.
Lord Hosidius? Interesting... What is this intelligence?
Some of my best people have been looking into the disappearance of Phileas Rimor and King Shayzien VII's journal. We now believe we have located both.
Hang on... Phileas Rimor?
That's right. Is there a problem, citizen?
Well... no. Sorry, carry on.
Very well... I will personally see to the rescue of Phileas. I need you to recover the journal.
Hang on... I thought this was about Lord Hosidius?
That it is, citizen. If our intelligence is to be believed, Lord Hosidius is now in possession of the journal.
That doesn't make sense! Why would Lord Hosidius want that journal?
That I don't know, citizen. Lord Hosidius is meant to be an ally to Shayzien. After all, he's married to my sister.
Perhaps this is some plot of his to grow his influence. He may wish to use the journal to discredit my family. Regardless, I need you to retrieve it. Only then will we be able to determine the truth.
This is all very odd. Do you know where he keeps the journal?

Apparently he has a private office hidden below the Hosidius Vinery. That will likely be where he's keeping it. You'll need to go there, find out how to enter this office and then recover the journal.
Okay. I'll let you know what I find.
Hello there citizen. Have you found that journal?
It's critical that you do so, as soon as possible. It will likely be in Lord Hosidius' hidden office below the Hosidius Vinery.
The human returns.
And needs our help again.
How do you know that?
It is our place to know.
Come human.
Tell us what you desire.
I was hoping you could take a look at this device and tell me more about the person that made it.
Why?
Why what?
Why should we help?
Because this device is the thing that was redirecting power from the Dark Altar. The person who made it was also responsible for the trapped soul that needed freeing.
The meddling mortal.
You have our attention.
And so we shall help you.
Hold still.
And we will begin.
Many have touched this device.
Humans.
Arceuus.
And two others.
Two others?
One touched by fire.
And one touched by darkness.
Darkness? That sounds like Xamphur. Can you tell how old he is?
His body was born long ago.
In the time of the great betrayer.
Great betrayer? Do you mean Xeric?
Do not speak that name.
It has no place here.
You know of him?
We know all too well.
But is that who you speak of?
It is.
So Lord Arceuus was right. What of this other person, the one touched by fire?
They are one of many.
Once born of Arceuus.
Now a child of fire.
A Pyromancer? Xamphur is working with a Pyromancer?
Hang on... I recently helped to repair some damage to the Doors of Dinh. What if this Pyromancer was the one responsible?
Impossible to say.
But a coincidence is unlikely.
Well then what's to stop them doing it again? We have to do something!
We?
We have no part in this.
We have already helped you.
Keeping the balance between life and death. That's your thing isn't it? If the Wintertodt escapes, it will destroy all life in Kourend. That doesn't seem very balanced!
The human makes a valid point.
Well it's been known to happen.
Very well.
The Dark Altar powers the Doors of Dinh.
We understand this power.
We can help reinforce them.
To prevent further sabotage.
Take a defence potion.
Add some volcanic sulphur.
Then return to us.
And we will enchant it.
Where can I get volcanic sulphur?
It can be mined in Lovakengj.
Got it. I'll be back soon.
Sulphur in a defence potion. Got it. I'll be back soon.
What am I meant to be doing again?
Alright. I'll be back soon.
I have the potion.
Then hold still.
It is done.
Now take the potion.
Pour it on the Doors of Dinh.
And your work will be done.
Alright. I'll get it sorted.
Take your potion.
I lost the potion.
You are lucky.
We prepared for such an outcome.
Okay. I'll get it sorted.
Well that's that done. I'd better get back to Lord Arceuus.
Hey! What are you doing with those doors?
Nothing...
Well you can either go through them or leave them alone.
Alright, I'll leave them alone...
I have. They confirmed that this Xamphur is the same one that served Xeric.
So it's as I feared. This is not good.
There's more. We discovered that Xamphur has been working with a Pyromancer. That means he may have been involved in the sabotage of the Doors of Dinh.
A Pyromancer? Do you know who?
I'm afraid not.
Are you sure about this? Had the Doors of Dinh fully failed, the Wintertodt would have destroyed Kourend. What would Xamphur gain from that?
I don't know, but the Tasakaal themselves confirmed it.
I will have someone look into this. We'll also use this new knowledge to try and locate Xamphur.
His master said they'd meet again in the south.
Interesting. This is useful information that could help our search. I wonder... could they mean the southern Kingdom of Varlamore?
Ah, but that's one for another time. I believe we've learnt all we can about Xamphur for now. Until we can locate him, we must turn our focus towards the Council.
So you'll support the new Royal Accord?
I will. While I have no desire to rule myself, I'll gladly support one of my fellow leaders in that role.
Thank you. I'd better go and speak with the others.
Hello there. You have my support with the Royal Accord. You should speak with the others.
Adventurer! You came!
Phileas?
You shouldn't be here! Time to die!
You came for me! I knew you would!
I don't understand Phileas. Why are you here?
These barbarians raided my home! They took me prisoner. I thought they were going to kill me!
But why?
I don't know. I heard one of them saying they'd been paid to do it. But who would pay to have me captured?
Wait! What about that parcel? The one with King Shayzien VII's journal. Do you have it?
No. They took it from me. You don't think that's what this was about, do you?
I'm not sure, but I don't like this at all. I need to speak with Lord Hosidius.
Lord Hosidius? What's he got to do with this? And what about me?
There's too much to explain right now. Now, there are a lot of barbarians outside, so I can't free you at the moment. I'll go get help. Don't worry, you'll be safe soon.
Alright. But please, don't take long.
Is it safe to free me yet?
Not yet. I need to go and speak to Lord Hosidius. Don't worry, you'll be safe soon.
We need to get some people down there urgently! The barbarians have Phileas Rimor prisoner.
Phileas Rimor? Who's Phileas Rimor?
He's a retired soldier from Shayzien. I helped him out with something a while ago, but he went missing. Turns out these barbarians were paid to take him.
Paid by whom?
I don't know for sure, but I doubt Lord Shayzien's visit was a coincidence.
So, it's as I feared. Still, that doesn't explain why Lord Shayzien would pay for one of his own citizens to be captured.
The thing I was helping Phileas with involved a mysterious parcel he'd received. The parcel contained King Shayzien VII's journal. When Phileas was captured, it was taken by the barbarians.
Before that happened, I followed some clues in the journal. They eventually led me to the discovery that King Shayzien VII may have been responsible for the creation of the lizardmen.
Ah, the discovery at Quidamortem. This is all starting to make sense. It's long been believed that King Shayzien VII eventually became Xeric. That discovery did little to suggest otherwise.
Lord Shayzien wouldn't have been too happy of further evidence that Xeric was part of his family. He must have made arrangements to hide as much of that evidence as possible.
Thank you, friend. I think we have all the information we need. I'll have some of my people head to this camp. They'll ensure Phileas is safe.
It's probably best he disappear for a while, for his own safety. I'll make the arrangements.
What of Lord Shayzien?
For now, nothing. We should keep this information to ourselves, until the time is right. As for the Royal Accord, I am ready to finalise things when you are.
Okay. I guess I'd better go and speak with the others.
Hello there. Thank you for your help earlier. You'll be pleased to know that Phileas is now safe.
That's good to hear. Thank you for taking care of him. I'd better go and speak with the others.
I need some help with Lady Lovakengj.
What do you need?
