She doesn't believe that Councillor Unkar has anything to do with this. She wants proof he's involved before she signs the new Royal Accord.
That's not too suprising. The two of them are old friends. I've got nothing on him, but I can think of one person who might be able to help.
Martin?
Exactly. His group has no doubt kept tabs on all of the councillors.
But he's been arrested. I can't just go and break him out.
No, but you can still talk to him. You've helped the Council enough that no one would think much of it if you paid him a visit.
Fair point, I suppose. If anyone asks, I can claim I'm trying to round up more of his group.
Nice idea. They took him to the Shayzien Prison, just west of the city.
Alright. I'll go and see what he knows.
I wanted to ask you something about the leaders.
Go ahead.
Have you spoken to Martin? He's in the Shayzien Prison, just west of the city.
I'll go and see what he knows.
Martin!
Sorry, but I can't let you talk to the prisoners.
But I'm here on Council business. I need to learn more about his group.
Ah yes! You're the one that helped with Councillor Hughes. Carry on then.
How are things Martin?
Oh wonderful! There's free food and a bed! Can you believe it? Luxury compared to anything in Port Piscarilius!
Well I'm glad you're keeping your spirits up. Now, I need your help with something.
Of course. Right down to business. As you can see, I'm a little indisposed right now. Apparently the right to protest isn't so much of a right after all.
Don't worry, it's just information I need. Things have progressed with the Council. I can't say any more here, but we're close. However, I need information on Councillor Unkar.
Excellent work my friend! From the moment I met you, I knew you were something special. Now, what information do you need on him?
Anything that could prove his corruption.
If I had information on his corruption, I might not be stood in a cell right now.
Of course, but you must have something on him. Anything could be helpful at this point.
I see. Well, there's a member of the Royal Society who has close access to Councillor Unkar's dealings. He gives me regular reports, but there hasn't been anything of note yet.
Still, things have progressed fast recently. Maybe he's had more luck since my imprisonment. As I'm stuck in here, perhaps you should go on my behalf to our usual meeting.
Sounds like a plan. Where does this meeting take place?
In the Shayzien Graveyard of Heroes. Look for a dwarf. He'll speak with you if you say the passphrase: 'Evil only triumphs when the good do nothing.'
Thanks for the help, Martin. We'll have you out of there soon.
Good luck friend. Finish this for all of us!
Hello again, Martin. Remind me, where is this meeting?
That was it. Thanks for the help.
Not a problem. Now get out there and finish this!
I know you! You're Jorra, Lady Lovakengj's assistant.
That's right. What brings you here, human?
Err...
The evening owl doesn't eat much pudding.
What?
I don't know.
Maybe you should go and lie down.
Evil only triumphs when the good do nothing.
Never have truer words been spoken. Martin sent you, right? I wasn't sure if anyone would come after he got arrested.
That's right. So you're with the Royal Society? How come?
Why wouldn't I be? The Council are nothing but trouble.
But things don't seem too bad in Lovakengj with them in charge.
Lady Lovakengj is in charge of Lovakengj, not the Council. Sure, Councillor Unkar might act like he plays a big part, but it's all empty words.
Do you not get sick of her asking for sherry?
Not really. It's not like it's a hard job. Councillor Unkar would see us all work to death in the mines instead.
I see. Well Councillor Unkar is why I'm here. I'm hoping you can give me something of note on him.

Any other day you'd be wasting your time, but today you're in luck. Due to the protests, Councillor Unkar has been staying at the castle for safety. I've had a chance to go through his private documents.
I think you'll find...
Wait! What was that?
Oh no. Not again!
Jorra Ashtar. You have been marked for death.
If tomorrow never comes, what is today?
Nothing.
Huh... Fair enough.
That was close! Are you okay human?
Martin warned me this would happen. The Council are trying to silence us!
It's not safe for me here. I need to get back to Lovakengj. Here, this should hopefully give you what you need.
Thanks Jorra. Stay safe.
You have what you need human. Now I need to get back to Lovakengj.
I have a declaration from the Council that I think you should see.
What? But... I don't understand.
The Council wanted to remove me from power? They can't do that! It's not their right!
And Councillor Unkar...
I'm sorry. Do you now see why we need to stop them?
Yes... I understand. I will support this Royal Accord.
And do you wish to be considered for the throne?
Oh... No. Leave that for someone else.
Very well. Thank you Lady Lovakengj. I'd better go and speak with the others.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
Oh... Let's see now...
Do you have any sherry?
Sherry? No.
Oh... Well I'm fine then.
Fair enough. I'll go speak with the others.
Hello Mori.
Hello again. Thank you for everything you did for Thana. You are a good friend to the people of Arceuus.
It's not a problem. Anyway, there was something I was hoping you could help me with.
Of course. What do you need?
I have a situation with the Disciples of Yama. I hear you've been looking into them.
Well... Yes, I have, but that research was meant to be a secret...
Ah well, you're trustworthy I suppose. What can I help you with?
What do you know of their leader, Yama?
He's a bit of a mystery. He's a demon of some sorts, but he doesn't seem to have any actual presence in Kourend yet. In fact, until recently, he had no connection to the cult.
The Disciples of Yama once had no connection to Yama?
It does sound odd, but back then they were known as the Disciples of Chaos. They were just a small Zamorakian cult of little note.
Interesting. So if Yama has no presence among his followers, how does he communicate with them?
Through another demon called the Voice of Yama.
So if I killed this Voice of Yama, the cultists would lose their connection to Yama?
For a time, though I imagine the Voice of Yama would be quickly replaced. However, if you wanted to remove that connection, I do have another idea...

After what happened with Thana, I volunteered to help out with the Dark Altar investigations. The device used there was redirecting power from the Altar, but a similar device could block a magical connection entirely.
Ah, I see. So we could use a device like that to block the connection between the Voice of Yama and Yama himself?
That's right. We never tried it before because the Dark Altar issues were more pressing, but I don't see why it wouldn't work.
Alright. So where can I get one of these devices?
I should be able to make you one. I'll need some molten glass and a dark essence block.
I have those right here.
Huh... Fair enough.
Right. You'll need to hide this somewhere in the Chasm of Fire. Here you go.
Alright. Thanks Mori.
Where can I get a dark essence block?
You can mine dense essence blocks from the mine north east of here. They can be turned into dark essence blocks using the Dark Altar.
Okay, I'll come back once I have what you need.
I can get those for you. I'll come back once I have them.
Hello again. Do you have some molten glass and a dark essence block yet?
Not yet. I'll come back once I have them.
I have them right here.
Hello Mori. What should I be doing with this device?
You just need to hide it somewhere in the Chasm of Fire.
Hello Mori. Do you think you could make me another one of those devices?
I have enough supplies for another. Here, you'll need to hide it somewhere in the Chasm of Fire.
Ah, there you are. Our master foresaw your arrival.
And you have the device as well. How wonderful.
How do you...
Oh look at you. You need a good rest. Here, have a lie down.
Well that's the device hidden. Those Disciples of Yama won't be a problem anymore. I'd better tell Lady Piscarilius.
Have you dealt with the Disciples of Yama yet?
It's all done.
Are you sure?
Absolutely. They won't be a problem anymore.
Good.
So will you now support this Royal Accord?
Yes, but it's still a stupid idea. And don't even think about trying to put me in charge or something. I'll have no more part in this.
I don't think you need to worry about that. Now, I'd better go and speak with the others.
Good. I've had enough of talking with you.
Clear off then.
Fine. I need to speak with the others anyway.
I hear your father has an office here.
Office? What office?
A secret one, I'm guessing?
There can't be any secret offices here. I'd have noticed. I notice lots of things, you know.
Well in that case, have you noticed your father doing anything interesting here in the past?
He sometimes comes to inspect the wine barrels. I like to inspect them myself sometimes.
More than inspect, by the looks of things. Thanks for the help.
You're welcome.
Hello there, citizen. Have you found that journal?
Excellent work.
It's sealed shut somehow.
Not to worry, I should be able to take care of that. When the time comes to finalise the Royal Accord, I will have the information we need to decide upon a new ruler.
Alright. Thank you, Lord Shayzien. I should speak to Commander Fullore.
Hello there, citizen. Thank you for your help earlier. I am ready to support this Royal Accord!
Alright. I'll go and talk with Commander Fullore.
Come with me. There's something you need to see.
Just come.
What the... Is he...?
Yup.
What happened? Did he jump?
I've no idea.
You don't think he was pushed, do you?
I don't think so.
What do we do now?
What can we do? Even Lord Arceuus can't bring back the dead. He's gone, and that's that.
Why did any of this have to happen?
We can't undo what's been done, but we can still put an end to all this.
Does that mean you have good news?
Kind of. I think I've managed to convince all the leaders to sign the Accord. That said, I have no idea who they'll pick to rule.
Well, we'll just have to make it work somehow. Maybe then we can finally end this nightmare.
I'll deal with this mess. Once I'm done, let's gather everyone downstairs again.
Shall we get on with this then?
Not yet. Where's Lord Hosidius and Lord Shayzien?
Lord Hosidius requested a private word with Lord Shayzien outside. I'm sure they'll be here soon.
In fact, I think I hear them now.
Now that everyone is here, I think we can begin.
What of the Councillor? Is he not joining us?
Councillor Orson is dead.
Dead? What happened?
Jumped from the top of the tower, probably. It doesn't matter, the world won't miss him. Let's move on.
Not the attitude I'd take, but it's true that we can't dwell on this. We need to focus on stopping Councillor Andrews.
Between the five of us, we can remove the Council from power with little violence. But what then? Are we willing to support a new Royal Accord?
Lord Arceuus, let's start with you. What will it take for a new Royal Accord to gain your support?
My position is a unique one. As such, I feel it would be inappropriate for me to involve myself too heavily in this. That said, I will gladly support the decision made by this group.
You would not wish to rule yourself?
I will gladly advise the next ruler in any way I can, but it should not be me who takes the throne. I would recommend you look to Lord Hosidius or Lord Shayzien for that.
Very well. Lady Piscarilius?
For the record, I think this is all a bad idea. Still, you're all clearly set on it, so I won't try and stop you.
However, I stand by what I said before. The people should have a say. Anything we decide here should not be finalised until the people have voted on it.
Any thoughts from anyone?
I would be happy to see the people have a say.
It could be a risky move.
And? Without it, I'm not signing your precious document. If I don't sign, you get nothing.
Hmm. Very well.
Assuming the people agree to the new Accord, who do you think should rule the kingdom?
Well not me, that's for sure. I can't imagine anything worse. Get one of these fools to do it.
Lady Lovakengj?
Huh? Me?
Yes. What do you think?
Well... This is all quite something. I suppose the Council have to go though, don't they?
Would you be willing to take over?
Oh... No, I don't think so. I think I'll have a sherry instead.
Lord Shayzien. What are your thoughts?
Well... I think the Royal Accord of Twill is a good starting point, but we'll need to make some changes for it to work.
Like what?
Lady Piscarilius wants the support of the people. Right now, they cry for a king. That means whoever takes the throne should take on the title of king or queen.
I also feel the act of transferring rulership from one house to the next - as in the original Accord - isn't going to work for us. What we need is consistency.
Would you be open to taking on the role yourself?
Err... No, I don't think that would be wise.
What?
Are you sure? You seem to be a perfect candidate.
I don't feel I would be best placed for it. It would be better if I kept my focus on the important task of protecting Kourend.
I suggest we make Lord Hosidius the new ruler of Kourend.
What the...
Lord Hosidius?
Thank you, Lord Shayzien. Taking the throne is not a duty to be considered lightly, but I believe my family and I have what it takes to shoulder this responsibility.
This decision will forever change the future of Kourend. If we go forward with this, the Hosidius family will be the new royal family of Kourend.
Well... This isn't quite what I expected, but sure. Let the idiot have his throne. As long as the people agree.
He can do it, I suppose.
Lord Hosidius would be a fitting choice for the role, assuming no one else here is willing.
Are you sure about this Lord Shayzien?
I... I am.
Then it sounds like we have an agreement.
My friends, thank you for putting your trust in me. This kingdom has suffered through much of late, but now it is time for that suffering to end.
In honour of her sacrifice, I name this declaration Rose's Accord. With it, the Kingdom of Great Kourend will no longer be a kingdom divided.
I promise not to let you down.
So... What just happened there?
It seems we might have a new king.
But Lord Shayzien? He seemed like a perfect candidate, but he didn't even want to be considered. What happened?
I think I might have some idea, but I'm still a bit confused to be honest.
Well, Lord Hosidius wants to have a word with you. Perhaps he can shed some light on all of this. He's downstairs.
I'll go and speak to him.
Hello there. No doubt you have questions about what just occurred.
You can say that again!
I'm sorry for keeping you in the dark, my friend. It wasn't anything against you. I just couldn't afford to take any risks.
You planned this all along, didn't you? That's why you kept the Royal Accord of Twill.
It was inevitable that one day the Council would fall. Their rule has always been fragile.
So you made sure that you'd be the one to replace them.
It gives me no pleasure, but this was needed for the safety of all of Kourend. Apart from Lord Shayzien, the other rulers had no interest in the throne. It was always going to be him or me.
And you didn't want it to be him?
It was for the safety of Kourend. Lord Shayzien has a good military mind, but he is no ruler. After all, you saw what he did with Phileas.
To Lord Shayzien, family name is everything. Above all else, he craves glory for himself and his house. Under him, war would have been inevitable.
War with who?
Varlamore, the kingdom to the south. Our two kingdoms were in conflict less than a hundred years ago, and relations remain sour. It would take very little for that conflict to be reignited.
You really think Lord Shayzien would have declared war?
I can't say for sure, but it was a risk I did not intend to take.
I see. So how did you do it?
A while ago, I managed to acquire the old journal of King Shayzien VII. I knew that I could use it to discredit Lord Shayzien and his family, so I made some arrangements.
Phileas' mystery parcel! That was you? You acted like you didn't even know him earlier!
Apologies for the misdirection. It was indeed me who sent that parcel.
Had I revealed the contents of the journal myself, I would likely have just been dismissed as trying to create a rift between our two houses. Phileas was the perfect third party.
But then Lord Shayzien had Phileas captured before he could reveal too much. This is all starting to make sense. You know, he actually blamed you for that!

Phileas' disappearance was an interesting twist. I hadn't expected something like that. Still, it actually made things even easier in the end. Once Phileas was safe, I told Lord Shayzien and gave him a choice.
Oh I see. You let him pick between supporting you or being exposed.
Exactly. The truth about Phileas would have lost him the support of his people and ruined his reputation.
So in the end, you never actually needed to discredit him at all. What about the journal? Lord Shayzien sent me to steal it from you, but surely he already had it.
I didn't want to risk losing the real journal. The one I sent to Phileas was a copy, with many bits removed. While I covered my tracks well, Lord Shayzien must have worked out I was involved.
And he sent me to recover the real journal.
Yes. Unfortunately for him, the one you stole was a fake. The real one is somewhere much safer.
You really thought of everything didn't you? How about the Accord? That was essential to your plans. I'm guessing it was no accident that Artur found it.
I can't take too much credit from Artur there. He did do most of the work himself. I'd been looking into the Accord for a while when Artur found my research.
When he went missing, I feared the worst. It was a nice surprise when you not only brought him back, but the Accord as well.
This is a lot to take in. I don't know if I like any of it.
Nor do I like it myself. However, when it comes to politics, there are no perfect options. Instead, all we can do is pick the best option we have.
Anyway, we will have plenty of time to discuss this later. For now, the Council needs to be dealt with. You should speak with Commander Fullore.
We will have to talk more later my friend. For now, the Council needs to be dealt with. You should speak with Commander Fullore.
Alright.
Hello there. It's time for us to deal with the Council. You should speak with Commander Fullore.
Will do. I just need to talk to Lord Hosidius first.
Lord Shayzien.
Ah... Hello there citizen.
What happened there? Why didn't you put yourself forward to become king?
Well... It was a complex choice, citizen. I wouldn't worry about it. We're all ready to deal with the Council. Let's focus on that.
Okay...
Oh, it's the human. Shouldn't you be speaking with Commander Fullore?
Actually I need to go talk to Lord Hosidius.
I guess so.
Fine. I need to speak with Lord Hosidius anyway.
Fine. I need to speak with Commander Fullore anyway.
Lord Hosidius wants to have a word with you. He's downstairs.
How did your chat with Lord Hosidius go?
It was definitely illuminating. It seems there was only ever really one option for Kourend's new ruler.
We'll have to talk about that later. It's time to pay a visit to the Council.
How are we doing this?
We'll join the five leaders and head to the castle. There, we'll tell the councillors everything we know and present Rose's Accord to them.
Do you think they'll come quietly?
They won't have a choice. Lord Shayzien commands the Shayzien Army, and I command the Royal Guard. They'll have no one to protect them.
What happens then?
They'll be imprisoned. It will be for the new ruler to decide their fates. As for that, we'll aim to hold the vote Lady Piscarilius requested as soon as possible.
Assuming the people support Rose's Accord, we can have Lord Hosidius crowned within a few days.
Do you think they'll support it?
I think so. Many are already calling out for a king, and Lord Hosidius is popular across the whole kingdom.
Sounds like we have everything covered, then. When do we depart?
As soon as you're ready. From what I hear, the protest is getting close to breaking point. We can't waste any more time.
Ready to pay the Council a visit?
Let's do this.
Hold the line! Under no circumstances can this castle be breached!
But Captain... They're citizens...
Did you not hear me? Hold the line!
That's right, hold the line! Show everyone who you really serve!
We serve Great Kourend! You are all in violation of the laws of this kingdom!
Laws set by your false Council! If you really served Kourend, you wouldn't be here defending those monsters!
Step back citizen!
Or what? You'll kill me? Go on! I dare you to do it! See what happens!
Yeah! You can't kill us all!
Stand back! I'm warning you!
Stand down, Captain Rachelle. This situation is now under my command.
Lord Shayzien? What's going on?
These citizens are to be protected. Ensure they do not enter the castle, but do not allow any harm to come to them.
As you wish, Lord Shayzien. It will be done.
Thank you, Captain. Now, myself and the other leaders will go and speak with the councillors. This situation will be resolved soon.
Ah, Lord Shayzien. It's good to have you here. Hopefully with your support we can get this protest under control.
Though I must say, I'm a bit confused as to why everyone else is here. Is something happening?
That would be one way to describe it Councillor. Lord Hosidius.
Councillor Andrews, Councillor Unkar. We are here to present a joint declaration from the five houses of Great Kourend.
Declaration? I don't understand.
We, the leaders of the five houses of Great Kourend, declare that the Kourend Council is no longer fit to rule. As such, you are relieved of your positions with immediate effect.
What the... What is this?
Furthermore, you will both hand yourselves over to Lord Shayzien's soldiers. They will take you into custody where you will await your trial.
Trial? Have you gone mad? Trial for what?
For the crimes of murder and high treason. Along with the now-deceased Liam Orson and Sophia Hughes, the two of you successfully conspired to murder King Kharedst IV and Crown Princess Rose.
Liam's... dead?
This is insanity! Guards! Arrest them at once!
Soldiers of the Kourend Royal Guard, you serve the rightful ruler of Kourend! That is not this man. Stand down and step aside!
No! You can't do this!
David... It's over...
Over? Only I decide when it's over! I am the rightful ruler of this kingdom and you all answer to me!
Guards.
Stay away from me! This is my throne! I worked too hard for you to just take it away! I'd rather die!
Do it.
No!
Take them away.
I need to do something first.
Don't take too long. Let me know when you're ready.
Well, look who it is!
Good to see you Martin.
Can you believe it? The coronation of a king! Truth be told, there were times I wondered if this day would ever come.
And is it everything you hoped for?
Everything and more, my friend. And to think they even let us vote on it as well! Fantastic!
Well the King certainly seems to have attracted plenty of guests.
Indeed. Seems that everyone wants to congratulate him... Or maybe they're just here for the food.
Either way, this will be an event for the ages.
Are all the leaders here as well?
Most of them. Lord Shayzien was here earlier but he left. To be honest, he didn't look to be enjoying himself.
That's not too suprising. Things weren't exactly straightforward between him and the King when this was all arranged.
Yes, I heard there was a bit of drama here and there. Still, that's Kourend for you.
Now, I'll let you go and mingle. I'm sure the King himself will want a word with you at some point as well.
Alright. Have fun Martin.
Good to see you friend.
Any word on Xamphur?
Nothing yet. However, we did manage to search his lair in Molch.
Find anything interesting?
Most of it had been cleared out before we arrived. There was some research left behind though. Notes on potential new spells.
Some are far too dangerous to use, but others we've found to be safe. We're preparing a tome of all the ones that are suitable. I'll make sure you get a copy once we're done.
That's very kind of you.
It's the least we can do after all you have done for us. Anyway, I won't keep you. Enjoy the coronation.
There you are! I was worried you'd miss all the fun.
No chance. It's not every day you crown a new king.
You can say that again. You should have seen all the preperations needed. Food, drinks, entertainment, invitations... The list goes on.
You'd think security would be one of the hard parts, but I actually reckon our bit is pretty straightforward in comparison.
On that note, how does it feel to be serving a king now?
I don't think it's quite sunk in yet. It still feels like it was only this morning that Councillor Hughes escaped. So much has happened in such a short time.
Tell me about it. Had I known how this would go when Martin first recruited me, I'd have probably considered running for the hills as fast as possible.
Well, I for one am glad you didn't. We'd have never reached this point without your help.
It wouldn't have been possible without you or Martin either. Have you two spoken yet?
Oh, I'm going to need a lot to drink before I'm ready for that conversation.
Anyway, have you seen our special guest?
It's a pleasure to finally welcome you to Great Kourend, Queen Zyanyi. You are very welcome here.
The pleasure is all mine. From today, the sun will shine on our two kingdoms once more. The mistakes of the past are now behind us.
Who is she?
Zyanyi Arkan, the Sun Queen. She's the ruler of Varlamore, the kingdom in the south. This is her first visit to Kourend.
First visit?
Indeed. The King personally invited her. He's keen to put an end to the animosity between the two kingdoms. Rumor has it she feels the same way.
Who are the knights with her?
Her royal guard, the Kualti.
They look fancy.
They do. If the stories are true, they're the best fighters in Varlamore.
Not jealous are you?
Not of that armour, that's for sure. It looks very uncomfortable.
Ah, looks like they're done. You should go and see the King. He was pretty keen to speak to you.
Okay. I'll see you later.
Good to see you, Your Majesty. Congratulations on your coronation.
Thank you my friend. Of course, none of this would have been possible without you. Let it be known that you will always be a friend of this kingdom.
Thank you, I'm very honoured.
As am I. In fact, I think this calls for a toast.
Gather around honoured guests! It's time for me to bore you all with a speech!
Friends, thank you all for joining me on this special day. This is the beginning of a new chapter for Kourend, and I could not be more grateful to have you all here to celebrate with me.
Still, let us not forget the hard road that led us here, nor those who were brave enough to walk along it.
Martin Holt, Lydia Fullore,. Without you, we would all still be living in ignorance. You opened our eyes to the truth, and ensured a strong future for Kourend.
Now, let us all raise our glasses to these three. We are forever in their debt.
Ah, there you are.
You wanted to speak to me?
I did. Sorry to take you away from the festivities. With everyone else celebrating, I thought it would be a good chance to talk in private. Don't worry. It won't take long.
It's not a problem. What did you want to discuss?
The councillors are behind bars and Kourend has a new ruler. On the surface, all is well again. Of course, that's not quite the case in reality.
You mean Xamphur?
Yes. The Council did not act alone. In fact, they weren't even the true orchestrators in this. We need to find and deal with the real foe before it's too late.
I'd be happy to help in any way I can. Xamphur and I have unfinished business.
I was hoping you'd say that. This is a serious threat we're facing, and I need people I can trust.
So, what do you need me to do?
Nothing for now. I just wanted to make sure you were on board. Once we have more information on Xamphur, I will let you know.
Now, we should head back downstairs before we are missed.
Is everything alright, Your Majesty?
I... I can't...
Kandur Hosidius. You have been marked for death.
Hey Lydia. How are you doing?

It's been a rough few days since the coronation, as you can probably imagine. One moment we were crowning a new king, that next we were burying him. I'm doing okay, though. Work is a good distraction.
And how's that going?
Well Artur Hosidius is now the King of Great Kourend. I'm sorry you couldn't be there for the ceremony. After what happened, they felt something small would be best.
That's fine. I think one coronation was enough for me. Any word on the killer?
There's no shortage of potential suspects, but nothing solid. We've had the murder weapon sent over to Lovakengj to be examined. They have a theory, but want to do more work before they confirm it.
Well let me know once they have something. I want to find whoever did this.
We will.
Anything else I can do in the meantime?
I don't think so. Lord Arceuus is trying to find out more about Xamphur, but he doesn't have anything yet. For now, all we can do is wait.
And on that note, I wanted to give you a little something to thank you for all that you've done. Not just for Kourend, but for me as well.
This is a bad situation we're in, but without you things would be a whole lot worse. Lord Arceuus also sent something over for you. He said you'd know what to do with it.
Now, I'll let you get going. Thanks again, for everything.
